display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: #999900; line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; word-wrap: normal;

div.div: Instructions are sent to an existing instance and can be one of Spawn to create a new instance, Invoke to call a method of that instance, or Delete to remove that instance.

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe flex-start; justify-content: unsafe flex-start; width: 136px; height: 1px; padding-top: 122px; margin-left: 264px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0; text-align: left;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: #4D9900; line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; word-wrap: normal;

div.div: Transactions are a list of Instructions that are applied as a whole. If any of the instructions fails, the whole transaction is rejected. Every Instruction must be signed by the appropriate signers.

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe flex-start; justify-content: unsafe flex-start; width: 136px; height: 1px; padding-top: 156px; margin-left: 1417px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0; text-align: left;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: #990000; line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; word-wrap: normal;

div.div: When an instance receives an instruction, the corresponding contract is called with a pointer to the instance. The contract will emit a set of StateChanges that define how the Global state should be evolved.

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe flex-start; width: 154px; height: 1px; padding-top: 826px; margin-left: 1661px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0; text-align: left;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: #990000; line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; word-wrap: normal;
div.font: Contract code can read the global state and emit StateChanges according to the Instruction received.

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe flex-start; width: 88px; height: 1px; padding-top: 718px; margin-left: 1659px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0; text-align: left;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: #000000; line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; word-wrap: normal;

div.div:
Instruction
Can be one of Spawn, Invoke, or Delete.

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe flex-start; width: 88px; height: 1px; padding-top: 718px; margin-left: 1759px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0; text-align: left;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: #000000; line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; word-wrap: normal;

div.div:
Coins
A list of different coins available to that contract.

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe flex-start; width: 88px; height: 1px; padding-top: 958px; margin-left: 1759px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0; text-align: left;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: #000000; line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; word-wrap: normal;

div.div:
Coins
An output of coins available, might be more or less than the input.

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe flex-start; width: 88px; height: 1px; padding-top: 974px; margin-left: 1661px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0; text-align: left;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: #000000; line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; word-wrap: normal;

div.div:
StateChange
Every StateChange is either Create, Update, or Remove and directly affects the global state.

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 38px; height: 1px; padding-top: 897px; margin-left: 1673px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: #000000; line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; word-wrap: normal;
display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 68px; height: 1px; padding-top: 811px; margin-left: 28px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: #000000; line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; word-wrap: normal;
display: flex; align-items: unsafe flex-start; justify-content: unsafe flex-start; width: 122px; height: 1px; padding-top: 130px; margin-left: 1063px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0; text-align: left;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: #000000; line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; word-wrap: normal;

div.div: The global state holds all instances and is split by Darcs that control the access to the connected instances. Every instruction sent to an instance must resolve a rule in the responsible Darc.

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe flex-start; justify-content: unsafe flex-start; width: 156px; height: 1px; padding-top: 330px; margin-left: 89px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0; text-align: left;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: #000000; line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; word-wrap: normal;

div.div: Clients connect to the ByzCoin service through a protobuf-over-websockets interface. Currently we have Go, Java and JavaScript APIs, but others like Python are easy to implement.

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe flex-start; justify-content: unsafe flex-start; width: 156px; height: 1px; padding-top: 273px; margin-left: 1684px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0; text-align: left;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: #000000; line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; word-wrap: normal;

div.div: Implementations of contracts are built into conodes. The execution of a contract produces a set of state changes. A quorum of conodes must execute the contract and produce agreeing sets of state changes before they are applied to the global state.

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe flex-start; width: 1px; height: 1px; padding-top: 772px; margin-left: 1490px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0; text-align: left;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: #000000; line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: nowrap;
display: flex; align-items: unsafe flex-start; justify-content: unsafe flex-start; width: 122px; height: 1px; padding-top: 600px; margin-left: 1473px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0; text-align: left;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: #000000; line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; word-wrap: normal;

div.div:
A Darc has a set of Rules/Expressions that describe how a rule (like Invoke:SendCoin) can be verified.
An expression is composed of and, or, and public keys and/or links to other Darcs.

switch.text: A Darc has a set of...

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 68px; height: 1px; padding-top: 810px; margin-left: 1928px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: #000000; line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; word-wrap: normal;
display: flex; align-items: unsafe flex-start; justify-content: unsafe flex-start; width: 227px; height: 1px; padding-top: 589px; margin-left: 32px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0; text-align: left; max-height: 172px; overflow: hidden;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: #000000; line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; word-wrap: normal;
div.p: This is an overview of our project, inspired by the awesome Ethereum Blockchain Mechanism by Lee Thomas. Code and documentation can be found at:

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 38px; height: 1px; padding-top: 474px; margin-left: 1166px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: #000000; line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; word-wrap: normal;
display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 1px; height: 1px; padding-top: 364px; margin-left: 338px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 37px; font-family: Helvetica; color: #4D9900; line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: nowrap;
display: flex; align-items: unsafe flex-start; justify-content: unsafe flex-start; width: 136px; height: 1px; padding-top: 384px; margin-left: 279px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0; text-align: left;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: #4D9900; line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; word-wrap: normal;

div.div: A proof has everything necessary to prove that a key is present (or absent) from the Global State.

a.text: Viewer does not support full SVG 1.1
